sense.name: Regain or make up for, as of a financial loss.
sense.examples: It's sometimes difficult to recoup one's losses. The London stock market recouped two-thirds of its losses in the wake of New York's early rally. I'm hoping to recoup my initial capital in the first quarter.

sense.name: Reimburse or compensate (someone), as for a loss or sacrifice.
sense.examples: Christ will recoup those who empty themselves to Him. Parliament recouped him for his expenses and gave him a handsome gratuity. I recouped him for the expense by holding a bank at faro.

sense.name: Retain and refrain from disbursing, as of payments.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Generally used as part of a business disciplinary process.
sense.examples: Allow employers to withhold/recoup employee wages if proper notice is not given.
